title: Operations on Functions
text:
Definitions & Rules
Given two functions \(f\) and \(g\):



Operation
Notation
Rule




Sum
\((f+g)(x)\)
\(f(x) + g(x)\)


Difference
\((f-g)(x)\)
\(f(x) - g(x)\)


Product
\((f \cdot g)(x)\)
\(f(x) \cdot g(x)\)



Notation: Let \(D_f\) be the domain of \(f\) and \(D_g\) be the domain of \(g\). The following notation applies.



Operation
Domain Notation




\((f+g)(x)\)
\(D_{f+g}\)


\((f-g)(x)\)
\(D_{f-g}\)


\((f\cdot g)(x)\)
\(D_{f\cdot g}\)



Domain Rule: The result is valid only where both \(f\) and \(g\) are valid (\(D_f \cap D_g\)).

title: Operations on Functions
text:
Example 1: Polynomials
Let \(f(x) = 3x + 2\) and \(g(x) = x - 5\).
Addition: \[(f+g)(x) = (3x+2) + (x-5) = \mathbf{4x - 3}\]
Subtraction: \[(f-g)(x) = (3x+2) - (x-5) = \mathbf{2x + 7}\]
Multiplication: \[(f \cdot g)(x) = (3x+2)(x-5) = \mathbf{3x^2 - 13x - 10}\]
Domain:

\(D_f = \mathbb{R}\)
\(D_g = \mathbb{R}\)
\(D_{f\cap g} = \mathbb{R}\)

title: Operations on Functions
text:
Example 2: Radicals (Domain Focus)
Let \(f(x) = \sqrt{x}\) and \(g(x) = \sqrt{4-x}\).
Operation: Find \((f+g)(x)\). \[(f+g)(x) = \sqrt{x} + \sqrt{4-x}\]
Finding the Domain:

For \(\sqrt{x}\), we need \(x \ge 0\). That is, \(D_f=[0,\infty)\)
For \(\sqrt{4-x}\), we need \(4-x \ge 0 \Rightarrow x \le 4\). That is, \(D_g=(-\infty,4]\)
Intersection: The domain is \(D_{f+g}=D_f\cap D_g = [0,\infty)\cap (-\infty,4]=[0, 4]\).

title: Operations on Functions
text:
Example 3: Rational Functions
Let \(f(x) = \frac{1}{x}\) and \(g(x) = \frac{2}{x+3}\).
Operation: Find \((f+g)(x)\).
\[\frac{1}{x} + \frac{2}{x+3}\]
LCD: \(x(x+3)\) \[= \frac{1(x+3) + 2(x)}{x(x+3)} = \frac{x + 3 + 2x}{x(x+3)} = \mathbf{\frac{3x+3}{x(x+3)}}\]

For \(f(x) = \frac{1}{x}\), we need \(x \neq 0\). That is, \(D_f=(-\infty,0)\cup(0,\infty)\).
For \(g(x)=\frac{2}{x+3}\), we need \(x+3\neq0 \Rightarrow x \neq -3\). That is, \(D_g=(-\infty,-3)\cup (-3,\infty)\)
Intersection: The domain is \(D_{f+g}=(-\infty, -3)\cup (-3,0)\cup(0,\infty)=\mathbb{R}\setminus \{-3,0\}\).

title: Operations on Functions
text:
Definition
\[ \left(\frac{f}{g}\right)(x) = \frac{f(x)}{g(x)}, \quad \text{where } g(x) \neq 0 \]
The domain is the intersection of domains, excluding any that makes the denominator zero.

title: Operations on Functions
text:
Example 1: Factoring (Simplifying)
Let \(f(x) = x^2 - 9\) and \(g(x) = x - 3\).
\[ \left(\frac{f}{g}\right)(x) = \frac{x^2 - 9}{x - 3} = \frac{(x+3)(x-3)}{x-3}=x+3\]

Restriction: \(x \neq 3\) (from original denominator). That is \(D_{f/g}=(-\infty,3)\cup(3,\infty)=\mathbb{R}\setminus\{3\}\)

title: Operations on Functions
text:
Example 2: Long Division
Divide \(f(x) = 3x^2 + 7x + 5\) by \(g(x) = x + 2\).
Solution
\[\require{enclose}
\begin{array}{rll}
3x + 1 && \\[-3pt]
x + 2 \enclose{longdiv}{3x^2 + 7x + 5}\kern-.2ex \\[-3pt]
\underline{-(3x^2 + 6x)} \phantom{+ 5} && \\[-3pt]
x + 5 && \\[-3pt]
\underline{-(x + 2)} && \\[-3pt]
3 && (\text{Remainder})
\end{array}\]

Quotient: \(3x + 1 + \frac{3}{x+2}\)
Restriction: \(x\neq-2\)
Domain: \(D_{f/g}=\mathbb{R}\setminus\{-2\}\)

title: Operations on Functions
text:
Example 3: Complex Fractions
Let \(f(x)=\frac{x}{x+1}\) and \(g(x)=\frac{2}{x}\).
\[ \left(\frac{f}{g}\right)(x) = \frac{\frac{x}{x+1}}{\frac{2}{x}} \]
Multiply by the reciprocal of the divisor: \[ \frac{x}{x+1} \cdot \frac{x}{2} = \mathbf{\frac{x^2}{2(x+1)}} \]

Domain: \(x \neq -1\) and \(x \neq 0\), so \(D_{f/g}=\mathbb{R}\setminus\{-1,0\}=(-\infty,-1)\cup(-1,0)\cup(0,\infty)=\{x\in \mathbb{R}|x\neq-1,x\neq0\}\)

title: Operations on Functions
text:
Example 1: Basic Polynomials
Let \(f(x) = 2x - 1\) and \(g(x) = x^2\).
A. Find \((f\circ g)(x)\) \[ f(g(x)) = f(x^2) = 2(x^2) - 1 = \mathbf{2x^2 - 1} \]
B. Find \((g\circ f)(x)\) \[ g(f(x)) = g(2x-1) = (2x-1)^2 = \mathbf{4x^2 - 4x + 1} \]

title: Operations on Functions
text:
Example 2: Radical Functions
Let \(f(x) = \sqrt{x}\) and \(g(x) = x - 2\).
Find \((f \circ g)(x)\):
\[ f(g(x)) = f(x-2) = \mathbf{\sqrt{x-2}} \] Domain: \(\{x|x \ge 2\}=[2,\infty)\).
Find \((g \circ f)(x)\):
\[ g(f(x)) = g(\sqrt{x}) = \mathbf{\sqrt{x} - 2} \]
Domain: \(\{x|x\ge 0\}=[0,\infty)\).

title: Operations on Functions
text:
Example 3: Evaluation
Let \(p(x) = x^2 + 1\) and \(q(x) = 3x\).
Find \((p \circ q)(2)\):
Method 1: Inner first

\(q(2) = 3(2) = 6\)
\(p(q(2)) = p(6) = 6^2 + 1 = 37\)

Method 2: Equation first

\(p(q(x)) = p(3x) = (3x)^2 + 1 = 9x^2 + 1\)
\(9(2)^2 + 1 = 36 + 1 = 37\)
